tweets.text:
⚠️ An amber flood warning is in place for all of #SouthYorkshire from tomorrow morning. 

Make sure you’re following @EnvAgencyYNE for the latest info, and you can sign up to receive flood warnings here: https://t.co/djzzUXttot. https://t.co/KOEu35oi8F

Looks like the weather forecast is essentially a bit naff this week so with heavy rain expected, it's probably wise to consider prepping for possible flooding. 
🌧️Sign up for flood alerts and warnings and find advice about how to stay safe 🌧️
https://t.co/QntMABm1g3

The #weather forecast predicts a lot of rain for later in the week, in #Kent and elsewhere...

So, we're making the most of the dry conditions near #Canterbury to remove wood and weeds from this trash screen - to keep the river flowing and not flooding...
#floodaware https://t.co/dDaYLUPavo

tweets.text: Our flood forecast shows the areas at risk of flooding over the next 5 days. Take action now - check your flood risk and sign up to our flood warning service for the latest info:  https://t.co/6jAgryn4Al #floodaware https://t.co/l5nqRpmidI

Is looking like a really tough few days ahead with a stark #forecast of “Significant inland #flooding impacts are probable from Tues to Thurs for parts of N, C & E England.” @EnvAgencyNW prep continues across #Lancashire #Cumbria & beyond. #Floodaware https://t.co/IrsyPsUPgC

Devastating report confirms the dreadful state of the Cam and its chalk stream tributaries but water companies and @EnvAgency escape blame. (Not surprisingly given Cambridge Water co-commissioned it) @CamLabEF   @greenarteries  @CPRECambs @Feargal_Sharkey  https://t.co/tbBkUTPpnN
@Bristol_People @briznrg @CllrSkhan @mthrel @EnvAgency Great idea! Put it forward to the Council.

tweets.text:
Water from #Ladybower Reservoir is being released to increase storage capacity, ahead of forecast heavy rain Monday pm. 

River levels will rise in the #Derwent, but will not lead to property #flooding. Action taken now allows water to move safely through before further rain. https://t.co/iRDTU6myK9

Is it business-as-usual at the @EnvAgency during the #COVID19 pandemic?

Tomorrow, we’re questioning its Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd and Chief Exec @JamesBevanEA, for more info see 👇

https://t.co/V132mxpky2 https://t.co/6zc6GTh6C3

tweets.text:
Hope they got out, but possible results of driving in floodwater:

🔴 You and your car get stuck
🔴 Your vehicle might float away... An ambulance did once!
🔴 The wave the driving causes can flood properties
🔴 Your engine won't thank you

Don't take the risk! https://t.co/e3x8RQWG8P

This covers the following areas: Bawtry, Bentley, Conisborough, Clay Lane, Fishlake, Intake, Mexborough, Scawthorpe, Tickhill and Wadworth.

Please stay alert and check flood warnings regularly @EnvAgencyYNE and check your area here https://t.co/PhaiEsZrkk

⚠️The @metoffice have issued an Amber weather warning for #rain in West Yorkshire. ⚠️

In place from 6am tomorrow until midnight Wednesday. 

#PrepareActSurvive

Find all of our flood awareness info here: https://t.co/i4gLVW9024

@EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency The trap is just before the river flows into the marsh at eastern end of Brent Reservoir. You can walk to it along path from Cool Oak Lane or access from Priestley Way, I imagine. Approx What3Words location of trap is https://t.co/p1NU1DU8cI

tweets.text: 2/2 We’ve installed 8 large steel stoplogs across the Foss channel to allow the barrier to operate as normal without a gate and they will remain in place until the new gate is in place and operable. Keep up to date with the latest flood warnings here: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb

1/2 High levels on the River #Ouse and rain forecast this week will delay our work to replace the gate on the #Foss Barrier in #York. As soon as levels fall then we will be able to continue. Ensuring that flood protection on the River Foss is maintained is our top priority. https://t.co/zAlcy4yGXE

In order to protect wild salmon stocks, should a cull of seals in river mouths be considered. Purely to see the popular opinion. Please share and add comments @ScottishEPA     @fms_scotland @EnvAgency @AnglingTrust @angling_times @taydsfb @AST_Salmon @SalmonTroutCons @SSPOsays
